alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Dale County through 700 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newton, or near Daleville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Midland City, Level Plains, Newton, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Sylvan Grove, Hunt Field, Waterford, Knox Field, Bagwells Crossroads, Kelly, Ewell, Browns Crossroads, Cairns Aaf, Hanchey Field and Klondyke Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
